Inspiration for play & learning

🛒Creator of the PlayTRAY™👇
@inspiremyplaystore 
🛒 Playful Printables subscription👇

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Laura | Inspire My Play ® on July 26, 2021 tagging @inspiremyplaystore. May be an image of child, food and indoor.

node.text:
SAND PLAY DOUGH CONSTRUCTION SITE
.
Sand play dough is one our favourite variations on regular play dough and it works perfectly for construction play! 
.
It is very similar to normal play dough but the added sand gives it a grainy, heavy texture, which is so much fun to explore.
.
To make it you will need:
.
*1 1/2 cups of flour
*1/2 cup of salt
*1 1/2 cups of sand
*2 tbsp of cream of tartar
*2 tbsp of coconut oil
*1 to 1 1/2 cups of boiling water.
.
Method:
.
Mix the dry ingredients, including the sand, together in a bowl.
.
Add the coconut oil and boiling water. Start with one cup and gradually add a little more if needed. How much you will need will depend on how dry the sand was that you used.
.
Mix until it comes together as a dough.
.
Once it has cooled a little, take it out the bowl and give it a good knead on the worktop.
.
Keep it in an air right container and it should last well.
.
In our PlayTRAY we had construction vehicles, pebbles, road signs, log slices and mini bricks. I always get asked about these and I’m not surprised- they’re so fun! I’ll link them in my stories for you. 
.
They’ll be a chance to win a PlayTRAY tomorrow, along with lots of other sensory play goodies, so keep your eyes peeled on my feed- I’ll be posting tomorrow morning 😀
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#playdough #playdoughfun #sensoryplay #sensorylearning #smallworldplay #smallworldideas #playtrayideas #playtray #playroomstorage #inspiremyplay #inspiremyplaytray #learningthroughplay #playmatters #playathome #playtolearn #playbasedlearning #todderplay #preschoolactivities #preschoollearning #earlyyears #eyfs #earlylearning #earlylearning101

node.text:
NATURE CONFETTI
.
Craft punches are so good for strengthening little hands! We used ours with leaves and petals to make nature confetti! We then used them to create pictures.
.
Whenever we make things with nature the girls are always keen to preserve it! It’s not always possible but this one can be laminated quite easily, which will keep it looking lovely for a long time.
.
Craft punches and lots of other crafty bits and bobs can be found in my Amazon storefront if you want to take a look. Link is in my bio. 😊
.
.
.
.
.
.
#natureplay #naturecrafts #naturecraftsforkids #playathome #learnthroughplay #playmatters #playactivities #playtolearn #earlylearning #finemotorskills #finemotoractivities #finemotorfun #creativeplay #artykids #inspiremyplay #artycraftykids #kidsatplay

node.text:
PEBBLE PROJECTS
.
We love a pebble project and it makes a great holiday activity.
.
These are a few of our favourite projects:
.
1.Food pebbles- great for pretend play-we use ours in the mud kitchen.
.
2. Alphabet pebbles- great for letter recognition and building words. These work particularly well with a construction site tray.
.
3. Number matching game. Hide these in a tray of rice or around the garden- match the numbers to the quantity. 
.
I tend to use @posca_uk pens for decorating pebbles and a cheaper brand for the kids with chunkier tips. For really little ones use paint sticks! These are all listed in my Amazon storefront- link in bio.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

#inspiremyplay #playtray #sensoryplay #trayplay #phonics #numberplay #diyresources #learnthroughplay #artycraftykids #earlylearning #kidsatplay #pretendplay #pretendplayfood

node.text:
SPONGE POPSICLES/LOLLIES
.
We had so much fun making these popsicles from sponges and of course mine have loved using them in the their pretend play since! Save this one for the summer break!
.
AD// Our new @artezaofficial tempera paints were absolutely perfect for this- the confetti & glitter paints worked so well to create a sprinkle effect on our popsicles! With 32 colours in the box it was so hard to choose!
.
What you need:
.
•White sponges
• Craft sticks/ popsicle sticks
• Craft Knife or pair of scissors.
• Paint
.
What to do:
.
• Use a pair of scissors or craft knife to shape your popsicle. I found large scissors the easiest to get a good finish. If you cut from the scourer pad side you will also find this easier and get a much cleaner finish.
.
•Once shaped, gently remove the scourer pad so you’re just left with the white sponge.
.
• Cut a slit in the bottom of the sponge for your craft stick. You want it be about 1-1.5 inches deep to hold the stick in place.
.
• Now it’s the fun part- decorating your popsicle! First make your sponge damp, squeezing out any excess water. This will help the paint to spread easily. Once painted on both sides leave them to dry completely.
.
Finally cut your craft stick down using scissors and poke the end in the slit you created earlier. It should be able to stay in place without glue. If not, make your slit a bit deeper.
.
A slight twist on this is to paint the sponges to print popsicles- we did this too and they looked fab!
,
These tempera paints are part of the @artezaofficial Back to School collection. They have tons of awesome products for kids & teachers ready for the new school year-their website is like heaven for me and my girls 😅. More details in my stories. 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#arteza #b2switharteza #artezauk #artezausa #artycraftykids #summerfun #summeractivitiesforkids #invitationtocreate #artforkids #craftforkids #artprojectsforkids #preschoolcrafts #eyfs #earlyyearsideas #earlyyears #getcreative #kidsatplay #inspiremyplay #teachersofinstagram #backtoschool #preschoolteacher #playbasedlearning

node.text:
ADD THE LEAVES TO THE SUNFLOWER- (Free printable)
.
A little activity for some downtime this holiday!
.
Download this for free from our Playful Printables page now (scroll down page to find our freebies). It’s a simple activity to add the correct number of leaves to the plant stem (6- 10 also available) and great for encouraging careful counting and 1-1 correspondence. Find the link in my bio or stories.
.
www.inspiremyplay.com/playfulprintables
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
CLOUD DOUGH ICE CREAM
.
This is a messy play favourite of ours! And when I say messy- this one can get really messy but it’s totally worth it! (Check out my stories for how it all ended!) 
.
So in honour of National Ice Cream Day this is how you make cloud dough ice cream. Cloud dough (also known as moon sand) is a crumbly mixture but can be compressed and moulded- perfect for ice cream play!
.
To make cloud dough mix 4 cups of flour with 1/2 cup of vegetable oil. (If making large quantities like we did double that amount). If you think your child may try eating the flour bake it in the oven first for 5 minutes.
.
If you want to make different colours divide the batch up before grating coloured chalk into them. To make the chocolate one add a spoonful of cocoa powder instead.
As an optional extra we added coloured rice to make sprinkles. You could use real sprinkles instead!
.
If you don’t have plastic cones, you could use real ice cream cones or dessert bowls. You can find these particular ice cream cones listed on my Amazon storefront under sensory play.
.
And of course you can buy the PlayTRAY from our website (www.inspiremyplaystore.com). Our US stock is arriving any day!- sign up to our newsletter on the website and we’ll let you know as soon as it’s available to order 🎉. You can find out more at @inspiremyplaystore.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#inspiremyplaytray #inspiremyplay #sensoryplay #messyplay #playtray #trayplay #learnthroughplay #sensorybin #sensorylearning #funwithkids #summerfunwithkids #earlylearning #earlyyears #earlylearning #earlylearning101 #eyfsathome #preschoolactivities

node.text:
DIY WATER-WALL
.
It feels like summer may have finally arrived in the U.K! If you’re looking for a fun garden project why not make a water wall for the kids!
.
We used the Ikea Skadis peg boards for this but there are plenty of pegboard options on Amazon. Look for ones made of plastic or metal ideally or if you do use the Skadis give it a good few coats of lacquer to help it last longer outdoors.
.
To make our water runs I bought a length of narrow guttering and cut it up. I repurposed some sensory stretch tubes, added a watering can and a water wheel. We also positioned a planter at the bottom to catch and re-use the water.
. 
I wanted the kids to be able to configure this on their own, which is where all the pegboard accessories come in so useful, especially the mini-bungee cords. These are all Skadis accessories but again have a little search on Amazon or in a hardware store as most pegboards come with a load of accessories these days.
.
As well as water, this is great to use with grains or as a ball run!
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#everydayplayhacks  #learningthroughplay #playideas #playathome #letthemplay #ikeahack #learnthroughplay #playmatters #earlyyears #earlylearning #playislearning #playbasedlearning #homeschool #homeschoolpreschool #homeeducation 
#preschoolplay 
#preschoolactivity #toddleractivities #eyfs #eyfsteacher #eyfsideas 
#diymum #playtolearn #earlylearning101 #handsonlearning #outdoorplay #activitiesforkids #earlychildhoodeducation #inspiremyplay

node.text:
POTATO STAMPS USING COOKIE CUTTERS
.
The easiest way to create potato stamps for printing!
.
Halve a potato and press a cookie cutter into it.
.
Turn the potato on it’s side and then cut through the potato to remove the parts around the cutter.
.
Finally, remove the cookie cutter and you’ll be left with a perfect shape for stamping!
.
.
.
.
.
.
#inspiremyplay #earlyyears #toddlerlife #artycraftykids #toddler #learningthroughplay #learnthroughplay #playfullearning #kidsatplay #playmatters #eyfs #earlychildhoodeducation #toddleractivities #playathome #eyfsteacher #preschoolplay #preschoolactivity #finemotorskills #finemotoractivities

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Laura | Inspire My Play ® on July 13, 2021.

node.text:
SKATING PENGUINS
.
Mine had such fun with this and it would be perfect for a hot day-hopefully we might see some of those soon! 🙏
.
To make skating penguins snap some craft sticks in half, stick them to the base of a mini muffin tin with a bit of blue tack and fill up the holes with water. Alternatively you can put clingfilm over your muffin tray, make slits and put your craft sticks through them and they should stand up. You might want to add a tiny bit of food colouring too if you like.
.
I put these in the freezer overnight and once we were ready to play, popped them out the tin. You should now be able to peel the blue tack from the bottom so that they glide smoothly across your tray- we used the PlayTRAY lid for this. Finally stick the penguins (or other characters you’d like to use) to the craft sticks with a bit of tape. You’re now ready to skate your penguins!🐧 
.
You can download these penguins along with lots of other printable activities from our member pages.
Head to the Playful Printables link in my bio for more info. 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#playideas #playathome #simpleplay #simpleactivities #learnthroughplay #playmatters #earlyyears #earlylearning #playislearning #playbasedlearning  #playathomemummy 
#preschoolplay #preschooler 
#preschoolactivity #preschoolathome #toddlerplay #eyfs #eyfsideas 
#sensoryplay 
#creativeplay #invitationtoplay #playtolearn #earlylearning101 #activitiesforkids  #kidsatplay #funforkids #inspiremyplay

node.text:
SUBTRACTION POM-POM PUSH
.
A little twist on an old favourite of ours- the pom-pom push! This one is a really visual way to explore subtraction.
.
The idea is to lay out the pom-poms on the holes and then push through the amount that you are subtracting before counting how many are left. You could easily add more holes to make it more challenging.
.
A little bit of tape at the bottom means you can record the answer using a chalk pen or similar, before wiping it off. 
.
You could also use it for counting backwards  or 1:1 correspondence-say the next number each time you push one through the hole.
.
Whenever I do a post involving a cardboard box I always get asked where I get my boxes from so I thought I’d show you how easy it is to turn a packaging box into a useable box for activities like this! For regular boxes (not pizza style) I do the same but just re-glue the sides once folded inside out. 🙌 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#inspiremyplay  #recycleandplay #toddlerplay #toddleractivities #finemotorskills #finemotoractivities #learnthroughplay #loosepartsplay #learningthroughplay #playtolearn #mathactivities #mathplay #playactivities #earlyyears #learningathome #playathome #playmatters #homeschool #earlylearning #eyfsideas #playfullearning #earlychildhoodeducation #cardboardboxcreative

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Laura | Inspire My Play ® on July 08, 2021. May be an image of dessert.

node.text:
BLEEDING TISSUE PAPER POPSICLES
.
This is a fun summer project using bleeding tissue paper to create lollies/popsicles! The kids weren’t the only ones to enjoy this! It’s such a fun and easy process- it’s pretty addictive! Read on for all the instructions...
.
Firstly though, if you’re new to bleeding tissue paper it’s a special type of tissue paper that is highly pigmented and the colour runs when it gets wet. You might find some regular tissue paper also does this, so it’s worth checking with what you have at home already, but it may not be quite a vibrant as this stuff. I bought this on Amazon- you can find a link my Amazon storefront under art & craft if you want some.
.
The other thing to mention is you can use regular card for this activity but I discovered last year that it works brilliantly with glossy photo card. The colours are so much more vibrant and photo card doesn’t wrinkle with the moisture like regular card does! Honestly it looks amazing 😍
.
So here’s what you’ll need:
.
•bleeding tissue paper 
•glossy photo paper/card
•lolly sticks 
• lolly template
• white crayon (optional)
.
Instructions:
.
1. Wet your piece of photo-card. 
2. Arrange strips of tissue paper onto the card in whatever design you like.
3. Spray with some water again to make sure everything is wet.
4. Leave for about 5 mins.
5. Remove the strips of tissue paper and allow to dry if needed.
6. On the back of the card draw around your popsicle template and cut out.
7. Use tape to stick a craft stick to the back.
.
To make the white sprinkle effect use a white crayon to draw them onto the photo card as a first step before wetting it and adding the tissue paper. The colour doesn’t take to the waxed areas leaving the patterns.
.
I love how unique each pattern is with this technique and how accessible it is to different ages! Just make sure you aren’t wearing best clothes as it can stain!
.
.
.
.
.

#craftykids #artforkids #creativeactivities #artycraftykids #creativeplay #summerholidayactivities #inspiremyplay #preschoolactivities #eyfs #learningathome #learningthroughplay #invitationtocreate #weekendactivity #getcreative #earlyyears #earlylearning #processartforkids #funathome

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Laura | Inspire My Play ® on July 07, 2021. May be an image of child, food and indoor.

node.text:
PETAL SOUP
.
Phew! Our PlayTRAY shipment has finally arrived and I couldn’t be more excited to see it hit more homes & early years settings around the world! 
.
Of all the activities we’ve shared petal soup has got to be one of our favourites. It’s so easy with just a bit of water & food colouring and some old flowers. 🙌
.
Things I like to add with this are pipettes/droppers, containers, ladles and sometimes, if they are in the perfume making mood, some essential oils. You can find these all in our Amazon storefront, along with lots of other sensory/ small world play goodies perfect for tray play.
.
And you can order the PlayTRAY now via our website www.inspiremyplaystore.com. Those waiting for our US shipment, I hope to have an update in the next couple of weeks. 👌
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#playtray #playtrayideas #inspiremyplaytray #sensoryplay #sensorybin #sensorylearning #montessoritoddler #montessorinursery #preschoolplay #childmindersofinstagram #childmindersuk 
#montessoriathome #montessoripreschool #earlyyears #earlyyearsideas #earlylearning #earlyyearseducation #learnthroughplay #learnthroughsenses #inspiremyplay
